ratings.comment: He tends to do a lot of rambling when he's lecturing, but you can tell he's ery passionate.

He was a terrific and energetic prof, he made classes interesting and enjoyable. I would definitely recommend taking his class. Except there are a lot of readings; discussion groups weren't too fun though

Travis is a great professor. He teaches at Penn State now. He is willing to help his students in any way possible. Travis is really knowledgeable and doesn't give busy work. One of the best classes I've taken.

Travis is awesome.  He's  awkwardly funny in a cute way, and he's really cool and always excited to get the class started.  He's only like 26/27 and really interested in learning and teaching and talking to students.  REALLY approachable, stop by his office hours.  Tests are pretty easy, just make a timeline and go over lecture notes.  Much love

Travis is, in a word, amazing.  It's impossible to go to his lectures and not be enthralled by his passion for the subject.  He turned one of my least favorite subjects (history) into something that I craved to learn more about.  His tests can be a bit difficult, but regardless, this class is worth taking for pure enjoyment.

Travis is amazing! He's super enthusiastic, incredibly knowledgeable and smart, really connects with the students... and he's HOT. You definitely need to do your reading, though... it's not from a textbook, just articles and selected chapters from books- I would recommend buying the course reader, they're all in there.

Travis is by far the best professor I've had. He's engaging, enthusiastic, and well prepared. Even in a large lecture, he does a good job of connecting with the students. Tests aren't difficult if you attend class, make a timeline, and do the readings. Wish he taught the whole course (2nd half was worthless and painfully boring!!). Take this class.

He knows his stuff, but there is something that just comes as stuck up to me. He tries to hard to be funny, and something just rubs me the wrong way. The tests are also very date intense. Make a time line!

Travis is a wonderful lecturer who is extremely enthusiastic and passionate about what he does!  First few weeks a bit dry, but picks up when he starts to play pretend.  Also loves talking about North Dakota and Alaska.  Young, friendly, all-around great guy that would even make a good friend!  MAKE A TIMELINE!

Travis is very enthusiastic and fun.  It pays to go to lecture-otherwise lecture outlines won't seem to make much sense.  Readings were rather dry and discussions are seemingly worthless-other than to hand in the 2 3-4 page papers that were due.  Exams are mostly short answer which means you have to know material inside-out as well.
very enthusiastic

Really enthusiastic about course material. Worked hard to make class interesting. Some lectures were extemely boring. Tests were pretty straight forward. Not too difficult, I'd reccomend this course to anyone.

Travis loves what he does, amazing lecturer!  very clear to understand main points, but tests are very hard to prepare for because he words them difficult.  A lot of your grade comes from discussion class, so do the readings!
Wow, he loves his job.  Pretty cute guy who is young and lively.  Really knows his stuff.  geo 339 is an amazing class
Very sharp and good-humored. Not half-bad to look at either.

For a grad student travis was the best prof i've ever had.  I haven't had a better lecturer at madison.  The only problem is his tests are all about dates, people, and specific events.  He stresses the broader picture but doesn't test you on it at all.  Otherwise this is a great class.

Travis is the best! He is very enthusiastic and funny, I wanted to go to every lecture! He really gets his students to think about issues rather than just present one-dimensional facts, which I really appreciated! Plus he's quite easy on the eyes! Everyoe should take his class!
I love Travis! He is so sweet and quite charming. Besides his good looks he definately knows his stuff and knows how to get it across.
Great Lecturer, very enthusiastic and makes the material interesting. Book pretty much covers same stuff as lecture, but still worth reading.

Travis is one of the best (if not the best) lecturers I've had at the University, and he isn't even a professor! He's personable, fun and his lectures are thought-provoking and inspirational. Very fair in grading and a great exam-writer. Highly recommended.
Bright, articulate, good sense of humor. Makes class interesting and clearly puts a lot of time and thought into structuring lectures. Always available to assist. Highly recommended.
